programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Both Stanley and Jeffrey argue with their wives and walk out on them at the same time. Getting drunk at a bar brings them together as buddies, but sobering up may open their eyes to a big problem they've unwittingly created.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: A fire in the kitchen leads to the Ropers having to stay with the Brookes family until their place is ready again. However, Stanley's behavior gets on Jeffrey's last nerve.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: James moves in to care for Vicky when she comes down with the measles.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry discourages Jackie's new romance with a policeman because of the danger of his profession.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The Rushes have to break the news of Rafkin's death to a bum who spent every Thanksgiving with him, but they can't bear to tell him that Rafkin was not a woman.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry is suspected of poisoning his estranged brother during what is supposed to be a reconciliation visit.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: A "Cosmic Cow" fanatic steals the puppet from the apartment so Henry and Monroe plan a stakeout to apprehend him.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: April's decision to move in with a rich, older man she has been dating creates an uproar at home.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: An old friend of Henry's who has a fondness for playing practical jokes comes to visit and claims he has only a short time to live.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: On a ski vacation, Sara and Jackie pick up two handsome brothers and leave Henry deserted until he meets the boys' glamorous mother.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: In her seventh month, Muriel is feeling unattractive and the beautiful young artist studying with Henry does not help her condition.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Sara and April's booming homemade cookie business crumbles when they are fined for disregarding city business regulations.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Faced with a hernia operation, Bannister goes to hospital, only to hear doom stories from his old roommate.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: When Bannister's heartbroken niece arrives for a visit, Howard goes into an over-protective frenzy.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Bannister fills in for Murray's dad on a father and son wilderness survival test.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.sub-title: A Chocolate Chip Off the Old Block
programme.desc: When Bannister loses the Grandpa Morgan Chocolate Chip Cookie account, help comes from a local bag lady who loves to bake.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Christian is seduced by an attractive friend of Edna's. In order to impress her, Jack represents himself as the manager of Cobb's.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Ethel tries to get a china horse, supposedly from the Ming Dynasty, away from Helen.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Stanley's physical checkup for a life insurance policy has him convinced his days are numbered.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Cobb's is in the middle of 'Swiss Week' but Bannister has traveling plans of his own; he's to be interviewed for a job in Italy. But there's no mention of him taking Edna. Suddenly an alarm in the store goes off and changes all his plans.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry suspects the London couple with whom Sara and Jackie swapped apartments are terrorists.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: The Rushes' new piano gets stuck in the stairway just as Muriel goes into labor, leaving Henry and Monroe to devise a way to get her out of the second floor and to the hospital.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Muriel's defense of Henry to her disapproving mother creates a rift which Henry has to heal.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry disowns Sara when she pursues a job on a talk show instead of her college degree.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: A Policeman's Wife is not a Happy One
programme.desc: Brad chooses a police street beat over a desk job, then calls off his wedding to spare Jackie the life of a cop's wife.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: After a week of Muriel's false labor pains, Henry reluctantly goes to a meeting with his boss, leaving Monroe in charge. First of two parts.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry gains a new son but loses his job when he misses his appointment with Wainwright to be with Muriel in the delivery room. Part 2 of 2

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.desc: Henry threatens to move out when Muriel's mother Iris comes to visit her new grandson and decides to stay.

programme.title: Too Close For Comfort
programme.sub-title: Who Was That Baby I Saw You With?
programme.desc: Muriel's photo session of babies with Cosmic Cow results in Andrew being taken by a slightly senile grandmother.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: It's contract negotiation time at Cobb's and after 12 years, Bannister feels he deserves a raise.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Although Edna wants the job herself, Bannister assigns Christian in charge of creating a store display.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Instead of spending the staff's money wisely, Bannister buys them a racehorse and enters it into a race the very next day.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Word of a new gold mine prompts Bannister to convince Edna to investigate their life savings.

programme.title: Check It Out
programme.desc: Birthday girl Edna receives flowers from one of her high school sweethearts who want to see her again. Their reunion gets interrupted when a jealous Bannister shows up and learns they were actually married.

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Whilst Ben is away on a course Susan is persuaded by Janey to go on the Facebook social network, which leads to her meeting up again with charming ex-boyfriend Paul Tremaine.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: The clock Stanley gives Helen for their anniversary turns out to be stolen from Brookes' apartment.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen is convinced Stanley is having an affair when she sees him give a locket to another women.

programme.title: Three's A Crowd
programme.desc: With his restaurant suddenly popular after a glowing review, Jack forgets about his and Vicky's first anniversary.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack and Chrissy apparently do Janet a disfavor by talking her into trying for a promotion at the florist shop where she works.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Greed tarnishes Mr. Roper's integrity when he is led to believe his old car is a valuable classic after he has sold it for $200 to Jack, Janet and Chrissy.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: Jack defends Chrissy's honor when a man who misunderstood her friendliness shows up at the apartment and no one knows he's a cop.

programme.title: Three's Company
programme.desc: A ruffled Helen Roper takes a cafeteria job to teach husband Stanley a lesson, but returns a wreck from the experience.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen hires Stanley's friend, Joey, to haul out their furniture so she can redecorate. Her brother in law, Hubert, hears of Helen's plan and decides to buy some new furniture. Joey offers to sell his furniture for him and sells it to Stanley. When Helen sees he bought her sister's furniture she freaks out.

programme.title: The Ropers
programme.desc: Helen really wants an electric organ but Stanley won't pay for one. Anne has an emergency and asks Helen to do her a favor by showing a buyer some property. An embarrassing situation may complicate things.
